title: TRESA Compliance Requirements
content: All real estate professionals must comply with TRESA requirements including mandatory representation agreements, disclosure obligations, and professional conduct standards. Non-compliance may result in disciplinary action.

title: Buyer Representation Agreement Rules
content: Real estate professionals must have a signed buyer representation agreement before showing properties. The agreement must clearly outline commission arrangements, duties, and term of representation.

title: Disclosure Obligations
content: Real estate professionals must disclose all material facts, conflicts of interest, and commission arrangements. Failure to disclose may result in penalties and legal liability.

title: Professional Conduct Standards
content: TRESA establishes higher professional conduct standards including continuing education requirements, ethical obligations, and client service standards.

title: Complaint and Discipline Process
content: RECO investigates complaints against real estate professionals. The process includes investigation, mediation, and disciplinary hearings with potential penalties including fines and license suspension.

title: Consumer Protection Measures
content: TRESA includes enhanced consumer protection measures such as mandatory written agreements, clear disclosure requirements, and improved complaint resolution processes.

title: Commission Disclosure Rules
content: All commission arrangements must be clearly disclosed in writing. Real estate professionals must explain how commissions are calculated and paid in buyer representation agreements.

title: Licensing and Registration
content: All real estate professionals must be licensed and registered under TRESA. Licensing requirements include education, examination, and ongoing professional development.

title: Record Keeping Requirements
content: Real estate professionals must maintain detailed records of all transactions, agreements, and client communications as required under TRESA regulations.

title: Penalties and Enforcement
content: TRESA violations can result in administrative penalties, fines up to $50,000 for individuals and $100,000 for corporations, license suspension or revocation, and criminal charges for serious offenses.
